name: gpx
description: Gcode to x3g converter for 3D printers running Sailfish

repo.name: GPX
repo.description: Gcode to x3g conversion post processor

readme.summary: Clear purpose and excellent installation instructions, but lacks a simple quick-start example and has no troubleshooting guidance.
readme.top_issue: No quick-start example showing the most basic usage - the README jumps from installation directly to a complex usage section with many flags, leaving users unsure how to perform their first conversion.

injection_risks.description: The function gpx_sio_open uses the filename parameter to open a file, which could potentially lead to an injection risk if the filename is not properly sanitized.
The function gpx_sio_open uses the baud_rate parameter to set the baud rate of the serial port, which could potentially lead to an injection risk if the baud_rate is not properly validated.

critical_findings: Potential injection risk in gpx_sio_open function
Lack of input validation for filename and baud_rate parameters
security.summary: The code has some security concerns, including potential injection risks and lack of input validation, but overall it appears to be well-structured and follows good coding practices.

common_complaints: Temperature limit constraints (nozzle temp capped too low)
Coordinate/positioning bugs (NaN/INF values, axis calibration issues)
Legacy Python 2 dependency blocking Debian packaging
sentiment.summary: GPX shows signs of decline with mostly unresolved technical issues dating back years, slow maintainer response, and outdated legacy dependencies preventing broader distribution.

red_flags: Occasional dismissive tone towards new contributors
Some responses are brief and could be more detailed
communication.summary: The maintainer's responses are generally helpful but could benefit from more clarity and detail, especially for less technical users.

concerns: No commits in over 2.5 years (last commit April 2023)
No activity in past 6 months across all metrics
15 open issues with no recent triage or resolution
No merged PRs or releases in past 6 months
Zero active contributors in past 6 months
No indication of maintenance or support
maintenance.summary: The gpx package is abandoned with no commits, releases, or contributor activity since April 2023, and 15 unresolved open issues.

analysis_summary.doc_summary: The documentation is generally well-structured and informative, but lacks a clear quick start guide and troubleshooting section.
concerns: No commits in the past six months
No merged PRs in the past six months
A significant number of open issues (12)
Docs: Lack of a dedicated troubleshooting section
Communication: Occasional dismissive tone towards new contributors
Communication: Some responses are brief and could be more detailed
Security: Potential injection risk in gpx_sio_open function
Security: Lack of input validation for filename and baud_rate parameters
highlights: Five contributors have been active in the past six months
